name: Tofu Tacos
description: If you like tacos, then you should try these crispy tofu tacos! They're incredibly delicious, perfectly spiced, and super comforting. I love to serve the crispy baked tofu cubes with avocado, corn, and an easy vegan yogurt sauce.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup unsweetened almond or soy milk
1 cup Frank's Red Hot Buffalo Wings sauce
1 cup unsweetened coconut or soy yogurt

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the tofu and pat it dry with a paper towel. Cut it into sticks or cubes. In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, the plant-based milk, the water, the paprika powder, the salt, and the black pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the tofu and pat it dry with a paper towel. Cut it into sticks or cubes. In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, the plant-based milk, the water, the paprika powder, the salt, and the black pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip the tofu sticks or cubes into the batter, so they’re completely coated. Then roll them in the panko breadcrumbs.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip the tofu sticks or cubes into the batter, so they’re completely coated. Then roll them in the panko breadcrumbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lay the tofu cubes or sticks on the baking sheet. Don’t put them on top of each other. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lay the tofu cubes or sticks on the baking sheet. Don’t put them on top of each other. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine Frank’s Red Hot Buffalo Wings sauce with a tablespoon of olive oil and pour it over the baked tofu. Evenly coat it from all sides by carefully stirring them a few times.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine Frank’s Red Hot Buffalo Wings sauce with a tablespoon of olive oil and pour it over the baked tofu. Evenly coat it from all sides by carefully stirring them a few times.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the coated tofu back on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake again for 20 minutes at 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the coated tofu back on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake again for 20 minutes at 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Roughly chop the lettuce and the red cabbage. Slice the avocado. Make the yogurt sauce: in a small bowl combine the plant-based yogurt, the minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Stir well.
recipeInstructions.name: Roughly chop the lettuce and the red cabbage. Slice the avocado. Make the yogurt sauce: in a small bowl combine the plant-based yogurt, the minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Stir well.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the baking time is over, reheat the store-bought tortillas in a skillet (30 seconds per side) or in the microwave (30 seconds on high). Arrange everything in the tortillas and drizzle the yogurt sauce on top. Sprinkle with freshly chopped cilantro and lime juice. Serve immediately!
recipeInstructions.name: Once the baking time is over, reheat the store-bought tortillas in a skillet (30 seconds per side) or in the microwave (30 seconds on high). Arrange everything in the tortillas and drizzle the yogurt sauce on top. Sprinkle with freshly chopped cilantro and lime juice. Serve immediately!
